bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Laura Armistead Carter, November 27, 1929

div1.p: Russell thanks Carter for her progress reports and states that he is hopeful that Frost will be able to complete his work on the manuscript of the History of Yellow Fever in the near future.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Laura Armistead Carter, November 27, 1929
div1.opener:
Book Misel. Russell
ASSOCIATE DIRECTORS
---
JOHN A. FERRELL, M.D.
VICTOR G. HEISER, M.D.
H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
WILBUR A. SAWYER, M.D.
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH DIVISION
FREDERICK F. RUSSELL, M.D., DIRECTOR
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
CABLE ADDRESS “ROCKFOUND”
SCIENTIFIC DIRECTORS
---
RUFUS COLE, M.D., CHAIRMAN
EUGENE L. BISHOP, M.D.
LOUIS I. DUBLIN, Ph.D.
WADE H. FROST, M.D.
FREDERICK F. RUSSELL, M.D.
WILSON G. SMILLIE, M.D.
C.-E. A. WINSLOW, Dr.P.H.
November 27, 1929
My dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
I have your letter of November 24,
1929 and appreciate your sending me the report of pro-
gress which you have made with the book. I see Dr.
Frost occasionally and several times he has spoken to
me about the work on the book. I hope before very
long that Dr. Frost will be able to complete the intro-
duction and editing.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, F F Russell Miss Laura A. Carter
The Westmoreland
2122 California Street, N.W.
Washington, D.C.
FFR:RVR
